explanations.A: This shape has three sides of equal length, shown by the three dashes.
explanations.B: What do the dashes on this shape mean? How many sides are the same length?
explanations.C: Not quite. If a triangle has two equal angles it must also have two sides of equal length.
explanations.D: What do the dashes on this shape mean? How many sides are the same length?

explanations.A: Isosceles triangles have two sides of equal length. What do the dashes on this shape mean?
explanations.B: Isosceles triangles have two angles of equal size. What do the angle markers on this shape mean?
explanations.C: Isosceles triangles have two sides of equal length. What do the dashes on this shape mean?
explanations.D: This shape is not isosceles, as there are no markings to show that the angles or side lengths are equal.

explanations.A: Not quite. A trapezium is a quadrilateral because it has four sides.
explanations.B: Not quite. A kite is a quadrilateral because it has four sides.
explanations.C: Not quite. A parallelogram is a quadrilateral because it has four sides.
explanations.D: A pentagon is a polygon with five sides. The others - trapezium, kite and parallelogram - are all quadrilaterals.

explanations.A: Not quite. A parallelogram has 4 sides.
explanations.B: A nonagon is a polygon with nine sides. Nine is odd. All the other shapes have an even number of sides.
explanations.C: Not quite. A hexagon has 6 sides.
explanations.D: Not quite. A dodecagon has 12 sides.

explanations.A: Remember a parallelogram has to have two pairs of parallel sides. Does a square or rhombus have this property too?
explanations.B: Remember a parallelogram has to have two pairs of parallel sides. Does a square or rhombus have this property too?
explanations.C: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides. Both a square and a rhombus (a ‘pushed-over’ square) have two pairs of parallel sides, and so are also parallelograms. They are special types of parallelograms, having additional properties.
explanations.D: Remember a parallelogram has to have two pairs of parallel sides. Does a square or rhombus have this property too?

explanations.A: A square actually has two pairs of parallel lines
explanations.B: A rectangle actually has two pairs of parallel lines
explanations.C: A trapezium has only one pair of parallel lines, by definition. All the other shapes listed have two pairs of parallel lines.
explanations.D: A parallelogram actually has two pairs of parallel sides.

explanations.C: A trapezium has exactly one pair of parallel sides, all the others have two pairs.
